title: Kyle Sandilands ditches Trial By Kyle for Love Island
text:
He's not afraid to speak his mind.

And on Thursday afternoon, shock jock Kyle Sandilands did just that by declaring he would be watching another reality show instead of the first episode of his own series, Trial By Kyle.

Taking to Twitter, the 48-year-old told fans on Twitter via his official page that he would be watching a rival show.

Breaking the rules: Kyle Sandilands decided against watching the first season of his Judge Judy-like show Trial By Kyle

'I’ll be watching @LoveIslandAU tonight, but you guys feel free to watch 8:30pm on @Channel10AU,' he tweeted in the hours leading up to the show.

Earlier in the morning he did what no star of their own series should do and promoted the Channel 9 show constantly while on air during his radio show.

'What if it's not as good as the pilot... this is what I'm worried about,' he expressed, referring to Trial By Kyle not living up to the pilot episode, which aired earlier this year.

PSA: The KIIS FM host told fans on Twitter he would be watching reality dating show instead of his own show

Reality clash: Both Love Island and Trial By Kyle both aired at 8:30pm on their respective channels but his show nudged out the dating show in the ratings with 363,000 metro viewers

He added: 'People will start tweeting: "Oh I hate his hair, he' s still fat."'

The Judge Judy-like show was picked up after its success on Ten's Pilot Week.

Trial By Kyle finished 16th for the night with 363,000 metro viewers while Love Island came in at 19th with 298,000 viewers.

Concerned: The shock jock told co-host Jackie 'O' he was worried about hater slamming and criticising the show

Kyle's Trial By Kyle co-star Anna Heinrich recently defended the shock jock's outspoken antics, stating that more people in Australian media should follow in Kyle's footsteps.

Speaking to the Herald Sun, the 32-year-old said: 'I really think the Australian media needs more people like him'.

She went on to say that Kyle's new $50 million dollar deal with KIIS FM is proof he has the formula down.

'He's just signed a new five-year contract to do his radio show with Jackie O. Clearly what he is doing is working,' she said.

'I really think the Australian media needs more people like him!' Kyle's co-star recently defended his outspoken antics

Anna went on: 'It's funny because I am the total opposite to Kyle. I think that's probably why we work so well together.'

Despite her admiration, Trial By Kyle's legal expert Anna has also hinted that she also experienced her own clashes with the show's 'judge' Kyle during filming.

Speaking to TV Week, the criminal lawyer described herself and the radio shock-jock as 'polar opposites'.

She said: 'I don't always agree with him and he certainly doesn't agree with me, but that's what makes it so fun.'
description: He's not afraid to speak his mind.
